content:
MonthCalendar Class

Definition

Represents a Windows control that enables the user to select a date using a visual monthly calendar display.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultBindingProperty("SelectionRange")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("DateChanged")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("SelectionRange")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.MonthCalendarDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class MonthCalendar : System.Windows.Forms.Control

Remarks

The MonthCalendar control allows the user to select a date using a visual display. You can limit the date and times that can be selected by setting the MinDate and MaxDate properties.

You can change the look of the calendar portion of the control by setting the ForeColor, Font, TitleBackColor, TitleForeColor, TrailingForeColor, and BackColor properties.

Note

The DateTimePicker control only supports Gregorian calendars.

Note

The DateTimePicker control only supports Gregorian calendars.

The MonthCalendar control is drawn by the operating system, so the Paint event is never raised. If you need to provide a customized look to the MonthCalendar control, you should override the OnPrint method, call the base implementation of OnPrint, and then perform custom painting.

If you need custom date formatting and a selection limited to just one date, you might consider using a DateTimePicker control instead of a MonthCalendar. Using the DateTimePicker eliminates much of the need for validating date/time values.

For more information on month calendar controls, see Month Calendar Control Reference.

Constructors

MonthCalendar()

Initializes a new instance of the MonthCalendar class.

public MonthCalendar ();

Remarks

The MonthCalendar constructor creates a new MonthCalendar.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the MonthCalendar class.

Item Description
SelectionStart Today's date.
SelectionEnd Today's date.

Properties

AnnuallyBoldedDates

Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determines which annual days are displayed in bold.

public DateTime[] AnnuallyBoldedDates { get; set; }
Value
DateTime[]

An array of DateTime objects.

Remarks

Using this property, you can assign an array of annual bold dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.

BackColor

Gets or sets the background color for the control.

public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the background color of the control. The default is the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor* property.

Remarks

The BackColor property does not support transparent colors unless the SupportsTransparentBackColor value of System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles is set to true.

The BackColor property is an ambient property. An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control. For example, a Button will have the same BackColor as its parent Form by default. For more information about ambient properties, see the AmbientProperties class or the Control class overview.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();.

BackgroundImage

Gets or sets the background image for the MonthCalendar

public override System.Drawing.Image BackgroundImage { get; set; }
Value
Image

The Image that is the background image for the MonthCalendar control.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

BackgroundImageLayout

Gets or sets a value indicating the layout for the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImage*.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout BackgroundImageLayout { get; set; }
Value
ImageLayout

One of the ImageLayout values.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

BoldedDates

Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determines which nonrecurring dates are displayed in bold.

public DateTime[] BoldedDates { get; set; }
Value
DateTime[]

The array of bold dates.

Remarks

Using this property, you can assign an array of bold dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.

CalendarDimensions

Gets or sets the number of columns and rows of months displayed.

public System.Drawing.Size CalendarDimensions { get; set; }
Value
Size

A Size with the number of columns and rows to use to display the calendar.

Remarks

Only one calendar year is displayed at a time, and the maximum number of months that can be displayed is 12. Valid combinations of columns and rows make a maximum product of 12; for values greater than 12, the display is modified on a best-fit basis.

CreateParams

Gets a CreateParams for creating a MonthCalendar control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams CreateParams { get; }
Value
CreateParams

A CreateParams with the information for creating a MonthCalendar control.

Remarks

The CreateParams property is called when a window is created. Inheriting classes can override this property to add extra functionality, but you should first call base.getCreateParams() to make sure the control continues to work correctly.

DefaultImeMode

Gets a value indicating the input method editor for the MonthCalendar.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode DefaultImeMode { get; }
Value
ImeMode

As implemented for this object, always ImeMode.

DefaultMargin

Gets the default margin settings for the MonthCalendar control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Padding DefaultMargin { get; }
Value
Padding

A Padding structure with a padding size of 9 pixels, for all of its edges.

DefaultSize

Gets the default size of the calendar.

protected override System.Drawing.Size DefaultSize { get; }
Value
Size

A Size specifying the height and width, in pixels, of the control.

Remarks

The DefaultSize property includes the area necessary to display the "Today:" date at the bottom of the calendar.

DoubleBuffered

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control should redraw its surface using a secondary buffer.

protected override bool DoubleBuffered { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the control should use a secondary buffer to redraw; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

Setting the DoubleBuffered property has no effect on the appearance of the MonthCalendar control.

FirstDayOfWeek

Gets or sets the first day of the week as displayed in the month calendar.

public System.Windows.Forms.Day FirstDayOfWeek { get; set; }
Value
Day

One of the Day values. The default is Day.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The assigned value is not one of the Day enumeration members.

ForeColor

Gets or sets the foreground color of the control.

public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

The foreground Color of the control. The default is the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultForeColor* property.

Remarks

The ForeColor property is an ambient property. An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control. For example, a Button will have the same BackColor as its parent Form by default. For more information about ambient properties, see the AmbientProperties class or the Control class overview.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();.

ImeMode

Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.

public System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode ImeMode { get; set; }
Value
ImeMode

One of the ImeMode values.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

MaxDate

Gets or sets the maximum allowable date.

public DateTime MaxDate { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime representing the maximum allowable date. The default is 12/31/9998.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is less than the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate*.

MaxSelectionCount

Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.

public int MaxSelectionCount { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum number of days that you can select. The default is 7.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is less than 1.

-or-

The MaxSelectionCount cannot be set.

Remarks

Setting this property does not effect the current selection range.

It is important to remember that the MaxSelectionCount property represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd. For example, if MaxSelectionCount is 7 (the default), SelectionStart and SelectionEnd can be no more than six days apart.

MinDate

Gets or sets the minimum allowable date.

public DateTime MinDate { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime representing the minimum allowable date. The default is 01/01/1753.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The date set is greater than the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate*.

-or-

The date set is earlier than 01/01/1753.

MonthlyBoldedDates

Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determine which monthly days to bold.

public DateTime[] MonthlyBoldedDates { get; set; }
Value
DateTime[]

An array of DateTime objects.

Remarks

Using this property, you assign an array of monthly bold dates. When you assign an array of dates, any preexisting dates are cleared.

Padding

Gets or sets the space between the edges of a MonthCalendar control and its contents.

public System.Windows.Forms.Padding Padding { get; set; }
Value
Padding

Padding in all cases.

Remarks

Setting the Padding property will have no effect on the appearance of the MonthCalendar.

RightToLeftLayout

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is laid out from right to left.

public virtual bool RightToLeftLayout { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the control is laid out from right to left; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RightToLeftLayout property is useful for international applications where the language is written from right to left. When the RightToLeft and RightToLeftLayout properties are both true,

Mirroring will be turned on for the form, and control placement and text will be from right to left.

ScrollChange

Gets or sets the scroll rate for a month calendar control.

public int ScrollChange { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A positive number representing the current scroll rate in number of months moved. The default is the number of months currently displayed. The maximum is 20,000.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than 0.

-or-

The value is greater than 20,000.

Remarks

The scroll rate is the number of months that the control moves its display when the user clicks a scroll arrow. If this value is 0, the number of months is reset to the default, which is the number of months displayed in the control. The maximum value is 20,000.

SelectionEnd

Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

public DateTime SelectionEnd { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime indicating the last date in the selection range.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The date value is less than the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate* value.

-or-

The date value is greater than the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate* value.

Remarks

If you set the value of the SelectionEnd property to a date that is earlier than the current value of the SelectionStart property, SelectionStart is automatically set equal to SelectionEnd.

If you set a date in SelectionEnd that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the MaxSelectionCount property, the value of SelectionStart is adjusted; SelectionStart is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to MaxSelectionCount.

Note

MaxSelectionCount represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd. For example, if MaxSelectionCount is 7 (the default), then SelectionStart and SelectionEnd can be no more than six days apart.

Note

Setting the SelectionRange for a MonthCalendar control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

SelectionRange

Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.

public System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange SelectionRange { get; set; }
Value
SelectionRange

A SelectionRange with the start and end dates of the selected range.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The stem.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start* value of the assigned SelectionRange is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.

-or-

The stem.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start* value of the assigned SelectionRange is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.

-or-

The stem.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End* value of the assigned SelectionRange is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.

-or-

The stem.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End* value of the assigned SelectionRange is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.

Remarks

Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the Start or End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange.

If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

Note

Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved). If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar to March changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001. If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.

Note

Setting the SelectionRange for a MonthCalendar control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

SelectionStart

Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

public DateTime SelectionStart { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime indicating the first date in the selection range.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The date value is less than stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate*.

-or-

The date value is greater than stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate*.

Remarks

If you set the value of the SelectionStart property to a date that is later than the current value of the SelectionEnd property, SelectionEnd is automatically set equal to SelectionStart.

If you set a date in SelectionStart that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the MaxSelectionCount property, the value of SelectionEnd is adjusted; SelectionEnd is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to MaxSelectionCount.

Note

MaxSelectionCount represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd. For example, if MaxSelectionCount is 7 (the default), then SelectionStart and SelectionEnd can be no more than six days apart.

Note

Setting the SelectionRange for a MonthCalendar control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

ShowToday

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the date represented by the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate* property is displayed at the bottom of the control.

public bool ShowToday { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if today's date is displayed; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The date is displayed in the format specified by the system settings for the short date format.

ShowTodayCircle

Gets or sets a value indicating whether today's date is identified with a circle or a square.

public bool ShowTodayCircle { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if today's date is identified with a circle or a square; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If ShowTodayCircle is true, and visual styles are enabled and supported on the computer running the application, today's date will be enclosed in a square, otherwise today's date will be circled.

ShowWeekNumbers

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the month calendar control displays week numbers (1-52) to the left of each row of days.

public bool ShowWeekNumbers { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the week numbers are displayed; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SingleMonthSize

Gets the minimum size to display one month of the calendar.

public System.Drawing.Size SingleMonthSize { get; }
Value
Size

The size, in pixels, necessary to fully display one month in the calendar.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The dimensions cannot be retrieved.

Remarks

The size information is presented in the form of the Width and Height members, representing the minimum width and height required to display one month in the control. The minimum required window size for a month calendar control depends on the currently selected font.

Size

Gets or sets the size of the MonthCalendar control.

public System.Drawing.Size Size { get; set; }
Value
Size

The Size of the MonthCalendar control.

Text

Gets or sets the text to display on the MonthCalendar.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

Null.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

TitleBackColor

Gets or sets a value indicating the background color of the title area of the calendar.

public System.Drawing.Color TitleBackColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color. The default is the system color for active captions.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is not a valid Color.

Remarks

The font color of the days-of-the-week text depends on the TitleBackColor property. Setting the TitleBackColor equal to the BackColor for the main display area of the calendar causes the days-of-the-week text to become unreadable.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();.

TitleForeColor

Gets or sets a value indicating the foreground color of the title area of the calendar.

public System.Drawing.Color TitleForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color. The default is the system color for active caption text.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is not a valid Color.

Remarks

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();.

TodayDate

Gets or sets the value that is used by MonthCalendar as today's date.

public DateTime TodayDate { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime representing today's date. The default value is the current system date.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than the minimum allowable date.

-or-

The value is greater than the maximum allowable date.

Remarks

By default, the TodayDate property returns the current system date, and the TodayDateSet property is false. Setting the TodayDate property sets the TodayDateSet property to true and, from that point, the value returned by the TodayDate property is the one the user sets.

TodayDateSet

Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate* property has been explicitly set.

public bool TodayDateSet { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the value for the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate* property has been explicitly set; otherwise, false. The default is false.

TrailingForeColor

Gets or sets a value indicating the color of days in months that are not fully displayed in the control.

public System.Drawing.Color TrailingForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color. The default is stem.Drawing.Color.Gray*.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is not a valid Color.

Remarks

When the calendar is displayed, some dates precede and some follow the months that are fully displayed. Using the TrailingForeColor property, you can modify the color of the text for those dates.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();.

Methods

AddAnnuallyBoldedDate(DateTime)

Adds a day that is displayed in bold on an annual basis in the month calendar.

public void AddAnnuallyBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to be displayed in bold.

Remarks

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method afterward to update the display.

To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of DateTime objects to the AnnuallyBoldedDates property.

AddBoldedDate(DateTime)

Adds a day to be displayed in bold in the month calendar.

public void AddBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to be displayed in bold.

Remarks

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method afterward to update the display.

To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of DateTime objects to the BoldedDates property.

AddMonthlyBoldedDate(DateTime)

Adds a day that is displayed in bold on a monthly basis in the month calendar.

public void AddMonthlyBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to be displayed in bold.

Remarks

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method afterward to update the display.

To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of DateTime objects to the MonthlyBoldedDates property.

CreateHandle()

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle* method.

protected override void CreateHandle ();

DefWndProc(Message)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefWndProc* method.

m
Message

The Windows Message to process.

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases all resources used by the MonthCalendar.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Remarks

This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with disposing set to false.

When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this MonthCalendar references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

GetDisplayRange(Boolean)

Retrieves date information that represents the low and high limits of the displayed dates of the control.

public System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange GetDisplayRange (bool visible);
visible
Boolean

true to retrieve only the dates that are fully contained in displayed months; otherwise, false.

Returns
SelectionRange

The begin and end dates of the displayed calendar.

Remarks

The GetDisplayRange method returns a SelectionRange that contains the begin and end dates displayed in the current view of the control. You can modify the returned range based on the value you specify for the visible parameter. By specifying false, you can retrieve all dates displayed on the control; specifying true retrieves only those dates that are part of fully displayed months.

HitTest(Point)

Returns an object with information on which portion of a month calendar control is at a location specified by a Point.

public System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo HitTest (System.Drawing.Point point);
point
Point

A Point containing the stem.Drawing.Point.X* and stem.Drawing.Point.Y* coordinates of the point to be hit tested.

Returns

A MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo that contains information about the specified point on the MonthCalendar.

HitTest(Int32,Int32)

Returns a MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo with information on which portion of a month calendar control is at a specified x- and y-coordinate.

public System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo HitTest (int x, int y);
x
Int32

The stem.Drawing.Point.X* coordinate of the point to be hit tested.

y
Int32

The stem.Drawing.Point.Y* coordinate of the point to be hit tested.

Returns

A MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo that contains information about the specified point on the MonthCalendar.

Remarks

The OnFontChanged method resizes the control based on the new font size. This can cause the calendar to overlap other controls on the form if the potential sizing issues have not been taken into account.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnFontChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

RemoveAllAnnuallyBoldedDates()

Removes all the annually bold dates.

public void RemoveAllAnnuallyBoldedDates ();

Remarks

This method clears all dates from the AnnuallyBoldedDates array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the RemoveAnnuallyBoldedDate method.

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

RemoveAllBoldedDates()

Removes all the nonrecurring bold dates.

public void RemoveAllBoldedDates ();

Remarks

This method clears the BoldedDates array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the RemoveBoldedDate method.

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

RemoveAllMonthlyBoldedDates()

Removes all the monthly bold dates.

public void RemoveAllMonthlyBoldedDates ();

Remarks

This method clears the MonthlyBoldedDates array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the RemoveMonthlyBoldedDate method.

You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

RemoveAnnuallyBoldedDate(DateTime)

Removes the specified date from the list of annually bold dates.

public void RemoveAnnuallyBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to remove from the date list.

Remarks

If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day and month are used. You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

RemoveBoldedDate(DateTime)

Removes the specified date from the list of nonrecurring bold dates.

public void RemoveBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to remove from the date list.

Remarks

If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. You must call the UpdateBoldedDates method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

RemoveMonthlyBoldedDate(DateTime)

Removes the specified date from the list of monthly bolded dates.

public void RemoveMonthlyBoldedDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to remove from the date list.

Remarks

If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day and month are used. You must call UpdateBoldedDates to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.SetBoundsCore* method.

x

y

width

height

specified

SetCalendarDimensions(Int32,Int32)

Sets the number of columns and rows of months to display.

public void SetCalendarDimensions (int x, int y);
x
Int32

The number of columns.

y
Int32

The number of rows.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

x or y is less than 1.

Remarks

The maximum number of months that you can display is 12, restricted to one calendar year. The product of the x and y parameters should be 12 or less. For values of x and y that have a product of more than 12, the greater of the x and y values will be iteratively reduced until the product is 12 or less.

SetDate(DateTime)

Sets a date as the currently selected date.

public void SetDate (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date to be selected.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than the minimum allowable date.

-or-

The value is greater than the maximum allowable date.

This exception will only be thrown if stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate* or stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate* have been set explicitly.

Remarks

This method sets the SelectionStart and the SelectionEnd properties to the specified date. This method is the functional equivalent of setting the selection range to a single day through the SetSelectionRange method or the SelectionRange property.

SetSelectionRange(DateTime,DateTime)

Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.

public void SetSelectionRange (DateTime date1, DateTime date2);
date1
DateTime

The beginning date of the selection range.

date2
DateTime

The end date of the selection range.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

date1 is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.

-or-

date1 is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.

-or-

date2 is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.

-or-

date2 is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.

This exception will only be thrown if stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate* or stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate* have been set explicitly.

Remarks

Using this method is functionally equivalent to setting the SelectionRange property. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd property.

If you set the date1 parameter greater than the date2 parameter, both dates are set to the date1 value.

Note

Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved). If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001. If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.

Note

Setting the SelectionRange for a MonthCalendar control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

ToString()

Returns a string that represents the MonthCalendar control.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents the current MonthCalendar.

Remarks

The string includes the type and the string returned by the ToString method of the SelectionRange property.

UpdateBoldedDates()

Repaints the bold dates to reflect the dates set in the lists of bold dates.

public void UpdateBoldedDates ();

Remarks

Use the UpdateBoldedDates method to reflect changes made to AnnuallyBoldedDates, MonthlyBoldedDates, or BoldedDates properties, either directly by modifying elements of the array or by using the add or remove methods provided to modify the date lists.

WndProc(Message)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc* method.

m
Message

The Windows Message to process.

Events

BackgroundImageChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImage* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageChanged;

BackgroundImageLayoutChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImageLayout* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageLayoutChanged;

Click

Occurs when the user clicks the MonthCalendar control.

public event EventHandler Click;

Remarks

The MonthCalendar control sets the ControlStyles bit flag to false, so the MonthCalendar will not raise the Click event.

DateChanged

Occurs when the date selected in the MonthCalendar changes.

public event System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventHandler DateChanged;

Remarks

The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. The DateSelected event is similar, but it occurs only at the end of a date selection made using the mouse.

For more information about handling events, see Events.

DateSelected

Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventHandler DateSelected;

Remarks

This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code.

For more information about handling events, see Events.

DoubleClick

Occurs when the user double-clicks the MonthCalendar control.

public event EventHandler DoubleClick;

Remarks

The MonthCalendar control sets the ControlStyles bit flag to false, so the MonthCalendar will not raise the DoubleClick event.

ImeModeChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.ImeMode* property has changed.

public event EventHandler ImeModeChanged;

MouseClick

Occurs when the user clicks the MonthCalendar control with the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseClick;

MouseDoubleClick

Occurs when the user double-clicks the MonthCalendar control with the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseDoubleClick;

PaddingChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Padding* property changes.

public event EventHandler PaddingChanged;

Remarks

This event is not relevant for this class.

Example

Paint

Occurs when the control is redrawn.

public event System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventHandler Paint;

Remarks

The MonthCalendar control sets the ControlStyles bit flag to false, so the MonthCalendar will not raise the Paint event. To provide a custom look to the MonthCalendar control, you should override the OnPrint method, call the base implementation of OnPrint, and then perform custom painting.

RightToLeftLayoutChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RightToLeftLayout* property changes.

public event EventHandler RightToLeftLayoutChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.

TextChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Text* property changes.

public event EventHandler TextChanged;

rawMetadata.title: MonthCalendar class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents a Windows control that enables the user to select a date using a visual monthly calendar display.
